message.content:
1. The study involved 60 patients.
2. All patients were newly diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
3. The mean age of the patients was 33.97 years.
4. The standard deviation of the patients' ages was 5.67 years.
5. The patients were randomly assigned to receive treatments.
6. One group of patients received once-daily subcutaneous liraglutide.
7. Another group of patients received oral metformin.

messages.content:
Statement: In this study, 60 patients newly diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus (mean age 33.97 ± 5.67 years) were randomly assigned to receive once-daily subcutaneous liraglutide or oral metformin.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
